currentPost.title: A Game of Cat and Mouse: Google’s New Algorithm Update
currentPost.excerpt: It seems that now, more than ever, there are continuous updates from Google for ranking, search results and just about [ More.. ]
currentPost.content:
It seems that now, more than ever, there are continuous updates from Google for ranking, search results and just about everything in-between. Websites continue to try and keep up, only to find that there are multiple rules, regulations, and laws that seem to change constantly. Due to this, professionals in a variety of fields strive to keep up with the changes and help their website rank. With all of the challenges these changes present, Doctor Genius can help clients keep up with these changes.

What you need to know

While it is beneficial for professionals to reach potential patients, clients or customers outside of the professionals’ local area, it is crucial to tap into the local market. While creating and maintaining a website is a crucial step, it is only the beginning. In order to rank, Google will scan a website for multiple factors:

  • Sitemap
  • Keywords on the website that match popular search results
  • The page title and meta description
  • Inbound links
  • Quantity and quality of words

By gaining notoriety and business with locals, professionals can create a solid source of profit with locals who will return in the future. Google is trying to provide a realistic experience for local users with information based on the exact time and location of the user. Thus, ranking in local search results is an important factor leading to one’s success. In 2016, WordStream found that 72 percent of consumers who conducted local searches visited a store within five miles.

As Joy Hawkins writes in an article on SearchEngineLand.com, “Google actively filters out listings from the local results that are similar to other listings that rank already,” adding that “Google picks the most relevant listing of the bunch and filters the rest.”

This algorithm can actually help some businesses rank better on local search results, especially when there are other professionals offering similar services in the same profession. While Google will not go into the specifics of their updates, Doctor Genius can follow these updates and adjust accordingly.

Doctor Genius has the knowledge and expertise

In 2016, WordStream found that 72 percent of consumers who conducted local searches visited a store within five miles.

The team at Doctor Genius has the knowledge and expertise to help patients rank on local search results. When we identify an issue with one of our client’s websites, we will find a solution to resolve the issue and continue to help the client. In this day and age, website maintenance is crucial to a website bringing in new patients, clients or customers.  We offer our clients constant support the entire way so that they can ask for our assistance when they need it.

When we discover or learn about any changes in Google’s algorithm, we will do everything we can to work with the changes and keep our client’s websites healthy. Give us a call for more information and begin going over your new website today.

prevPost.title: Brick by Brick Part I:  A Website Built Strong From the Start
prevPost.excerpt: A strong foundation is everything when it comes to a website. Without a strong foundation, the website will never accomplish [ More.. ]
prevPost.content:
A strong foundation is everything when it comes to a website. Without a strong foundation, the website will never accomplish what it sets out to do and much like the foundation of a house built on sand, it will fail under pressure. While DIY services make creating and maintaining a website easy, there is always someone working on the website’s code through the back door. However, it can be difficult to find a service specializing in website maintenance and design, while also specializing in content for various medical professions.

Start off with a strong foot forward

At Doctor Genius, we strive to create an effective website with quality content pertaining to the client’s profession. From the first meeting, our team works with the client to create a website that meets the client’s needs and Google’s search engine specifications. One of the biggest factors to help a website rank high up near the top of search results is using keywords.

Keywords are terms or phrases that pertain to the client’s area of expertise and ranks highly due to popularity on search engines. A search engine will target keywords, to sum up the page and help direct people to the page. For instance, a dentist who uses the keyword “Teeth Whitening,” will be able to attract people to the website who are searching for that term.

However, keywords are only one of the first steps to building an effective website. We can help our clients start off with a strong foot forward with several crucial factors, including:

  • Constant website maintenance
  • Technology to review ranking traffic
  • Mobile-First website
  • Regular website backups
  • Call tracking system

We are here to help every step of the way

Doctor Genius will provide the information about your website that you need on a regular basis, when you need it.

At Doctor Genius, we do not stop after developing a website and continue to work with the client every step of the way. When a client needs help or has a request, we are available to listen to the client’s concerns and find a solution. With in-house support and IT departments, our team will deal with any issue as soon as possible.

We provide the constant maintenance your website will need to remain active and effectively reach potential patients. We will not only build the website but will also continue to provide the necessary content. During the Brick By Brick series, we will explore several factors that help make an effective website, such as:

  • Social media marketing
  • An effective and educational content marketing system
  • Consistent stream of content to keep a website active

While these are only a few factors of the type of content that people need to create and maintain an effective website, they are some of the most important factors. If you are interested in learning more about our services or wish to invest in creating an effective website, call us today.

nextPost.title: Bringing More Patients to Your Door: Increasing Click-Through and Conversion Rate
nextPost.excerpt: You have the knowledge, you have the expertise in your medical field, you have the location and now you just [ More.. ]
nextPost.content:
You have the knowledge, you have the expertise in your medical field, you have the location and now you just need the online presence to be a beacon that brings in new patients. The only issue is that you do not have the time to focus on click-through rate. Fortunately, Doctor Genius will not only help maintain a presence, but can also utilize tools to enhance the click-through and conversion rate. People may not realize that click-through rate is for ads where conversion rate measures website traffic.

More than just an ad

An ad for one’s practice is not nearly as simple as just stating the name and a service. Professional practices need to use the right words, structure and presentation to increase the chance of click-through rates. While these factors are important to helping potential patients click on an ad or landing page to go to the official website, there is a learning curve to effectively increasing the click through rate.

To clarify, click-through rate is the measure of the number of people who view a piece of content with the “Click here to read more” button and follow through on the action. Hootsuite.com explains, “If 100 people saw your ad in Google and one person clicked on the ad, you would have a click-through-rate of 1.0 percent.”

Since the methods for increasing a click-through rate differ for various fields of business, there may not be a single method for increasing the rate. Fortunately, Doctor Genius has the knowledge and skills to improve a website’s click-through rate.

Website Structure

In 2016, Ascend2 found that 54 percent of marketers say increasing the engagement rate is their top email marketing priority.

Similar to click-through rate, conversion rate is the measure of website visitors who follow through on an action within the page of the website. The difference being that the individual is already on the website. However, the website needs to have an easy-to-navigate structure so people want to stay on the website and can find the information they need. Smartphones are becoming the popular choice for people searching through websites on the Internet.

In 2015, Google found that 65 percent of smartphone users look for the most relevant information through a Google Search on their smartphone without much emphasis on the company providing the information. Smartphones are a universal tool that can complete both an Internet search and Facebook post at the same time. Thus, having a website structure that works on both desktop computers and phones will greatly benefit the practice.

At Doctor Genius, we develop a mobile-first website that displays properly on smartphones and other devices. We also focus on achieving high conversion and click-through rates for you.
